# NSUIViewToolbarItem

**Class**

An item in a window’s toolbar that hosts a custom UIKit view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class NSUIViewToolbarItem
```

## Overview

The [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSUIViewToolbarItem] class lets you display a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView] in an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppKit/NSToolbar]. Use this class if you have a custom UIKit view you want to appear as a control in a toolbar when you build your app with Mac Catalyst.

For UIKit controls that support behavioral styles, set [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIButton/preferredBehavioralStyle] to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBehavioralStyle/mac] if you want them to appear in the toolbar with the appearance and behavior of AppKit controls.

## Creating a toolbar item

- **init(itemIdentifier:uiView:)**: Creates a toolbar item with the identifier and underlying UIKit view you specify.

## Managing the view

- **uiView**: The UIKit view to host in an AppKit toolbar.

## Items

- **NSToolbarItem**: A single item that appears in a window’s toolbar.
- **NSToolbarItemGroup**: A group of subitems in a toolbar item.
- **NSToolbarItemGroup.ControlRepresentation**
- **NSToolbarItemGroup.SelectionMode**: A value that indicates how a grouped toolbar item selects its subitems.
- **NSMenuToolbarItem**: A control that presents a menu in a window’s toolbar.
- **NSSearchToolbarItem**: A toolbar item that contains a search field optimized for performing text-based searches.
- **NSTrackingSeparatorToolbarItem**: A toolbar separator that aligns with the vertical split view in the same window.

## Inherits From

- NSToolbarItem
